channel.title: Lahman on DataScience
channel.description: Recent content in Lahman on DataScience

item.title: Data Visualization
item.description: Scattered plot Data visualization is a general term that describes any effort to help people understand the significance of data by placing it in a visual context. Patterns, trends and correlations that might go undetected in text-based data can be exposed and recognized easier. Here we will explore following libraries dplyr , Lahman , ggplot2 and ggiraph Lets fetch data from Lahman database about all the players whose Home runs are more than 400 and store it in a data frame df.

item.title: Data Visualization -2
item.description: Bar graph and Histogram In this post we’ll learn to draw Bar-graph and Histogram using the following libraries. > dplyr , > Lahman , > ggplot2 and > ggiraph Here we will all the teams who played in the year 1980’s. data1<-Teams%>% filter(yearID==1980)%>% select(teamID,HR) data1 ## teamID HR ## 1 ATL 144 ## 2 BAL 156 ## 3 BOS 162 ## 4 CAL 106 ## 5 CHA 91 ## 6 CHN 107 ## 7 CIN 113 ## 8 CLE 89 ## 9 DET 143 ## 10 HOU 75 ## 11 KCA 115 ## 12 LAN 148 ## 13 MIN 99 ## 14 ML4 203 ## 15 MON 114 ## 16 NYA 189 ## 17 NYN 61 ## 18 OAK 137 ## 19 PHI 117 ## 20 PIT 116 ## 21 SDN 67 ## 22 SEA 104 ## 23 SFN 80 ## 24 SLN 101 ## 25 TEX 124 ## 26 TOR 126 and plot a bar-graph !
